meanings.definition: Fuffs (noun): A soft, fluffy material used for stuffing pillows or cushions.
meanings.sent1: The fuffs inside the pillow made it so comfortable to rest on.
meanings.sent2: She bought a bag of fuffs to refill her favorite cushion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the fuffs, creating a mess in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky looked like giant fuffs floating above us.
meanings.sent5: The fuffs felt like a cloud hugging you when you lay your head on them.

meanings.definition: Fuffs (verb): To fluff or puff up, as in fluffing a pillow.
meanings.sent1: She gently fuffs the pillow to make it soft and cozy.
meanings.sent2: After washing the blanket, she fuffs it to make it fluffy again.
meanings.sent3: He fuffs his hair before going out to give it some volume.
meanings.sent4: The wind fuffs the dandelion seeds, carrying them away in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The baker fuffs the dough to make it rise beautifully in the oven.

meanings.definition: Fuffs (adjective): Describing something fluffy or puffy in texture.
meanings.sent1: The little girl hugged her fuffs teddy bear tightly.
meanings.sent2: The fuffs clouds in the sky looked like cotton candy.
meanings.sent3: The fuffs marshmallows melted in the hot chocolate, creating a sweet treat.
meanings.sent4: Her fuffs jacket kept her warm and cozy during the winter.
meanings.sent5: The fuffs feathers on the bird's chest were incredibly soft to touch.
